thread.title: NBN Co axes COO role
thread.title_full: NBN Co axes COO role | The Australian

author: The Australian
title: NBN Co axes COO role
text:
The former Telstra executive was brought in two years ago to replace Ralph Steffens to lead a new look NBN Co’s network design and deployment activities.
Prior to taking up the role at NBN Co, Mr Adcock spent the past 20 years working for Telstra, and played a key role in the negotiations between NBN Co and Telstra involving its copper network and the renegotiation Definitive Agreements between the two parties.
According to NBN Co, Mr Adcock’s departure is tied to the company’s decision to shutter the COO role permanently. Instead the company is looking to recruit a chief network engineering officer.
That role will be temporarily filled by Peter Ryan, who previously served as executive general manager regional deployment at NBN.
“Greg leaves the Network Engineering and Deployment team with strong leaders, ready to scale and accelerate the build of the NBN network,” NBN Co boss Bill Morrow said.
Mr Adcock will move into an advisory role reporting direct to the Chief Executive Officer until his departure.
